AbilityBonusOption.Description: This faction can recruit outcasts from other lands. They may be Men, Fallen, or another unexpected being.

GameModifier.Provides: This faction can recruit outcasts from other lands. They may be Men, Fallen, or another unexpected being.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: What was Curgen's imperative to his sons, if not honor? The Titans are gone, and it is time to serve a strong master once more. The Quendar prize honor and strength, but does not honor persist beyond battles and years? Do not those who prove a new strength, deserve honorable servants? I shall serve the country that promises to endure.

We Krax know survival. I have been cast out, but if you take me in I will prove the strength of my people. Even if I must fight my old brothers and sisters themselves, our opponents shall know my strength.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: Ha! What does it matter, the side one fights on? Does it matter, who is slain, Fallen or Man-ling? It does not. What matters is that the mighty strived and bled. Let it be known D'rogs strode for this country! Let its opponents tremble, for D'rogs fight for it!

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: Nobility is in action. And the magic in these veins shall serve any country that upholds nobility and honor.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: I do not care who I fight. So long as I do so for purpose, I shall fight back the Dred'nir themselves!

UnitType.Description: Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
UnitType.Backstory: I am no trader. I care little for money or trade, but your society seems to have a purpose I can follow.
I am a poor armorer. But I am hearty, and will lend you a stout arm to defeat your foes.

UnitType.Description: Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
UnitType.Backstory: My kind are rarely pensive. But I have many ideas, and know I am called to greatness. Give me a chance to prove my potential.

UnitType.Description: Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
UnitType.Backstory: We are all bound to Ceresa, by magic. But at distance, the bond weakens. I know my destiny is not as a Wraith servant, but for something more.
I was bound to a channeler long ago. She was murdered, and yet I did not fade away. For a long time I have wandered, and I believe I can now serve you.

UnitType.Description: These outcasts are like Altarian Henchmen, called to serve by the tolerance of your country.
UnitType.Backstory: What was Curgen's imperative to his sons, if not honor? The Titans are gone, and it is time to serve a strong master once more. The Quendar prize honor and strength, but does not honor persist beyond battles and years? Do not those who prove a new strength, deserve honorable servants? I shall serve the country that promises to endure.

UnitType.Backstory: What was Curgen's imperative to his sons, if not honor? The Titans are gone, and it is time to serve a strong master once more. UnitType.Backstory: What was Curgen's imperative to his sons, if not honor? The Titans are gone, and it is time to serve a strong master once more. The Quendar prize honor and strength, but does not honor persist beyond battles and years? Do not those who prove a new strength, deserve honorable servants? I shall serve the country that promises to endure.

SpellDef.Description: Call out for a fledgling champion (henchman) that has been rejected by other empires or kingdoms. What form will this forsaken yet bright potential take?
Call out for a fledgling Quendar champion (henchman) that has been rejected by Magnar.

UnitStatType.Description: Is this unit capable of summoning a Quendar henchman?
